citation.article-title: Methermicoccus shengliensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic, methylotrophic methanogen isolated from oil-production water, and proposal of Methermicoccaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methermicoccus (Me.ther.mi.coc′cus. N.L. masc. n. Methermicoccus arbitrary name referring to a small, thermophilic, methane-producing coccus).
Small cocci with a mean diameter of 0.7 μm.
Growth occurs at temperatures up to 70 °C; no growth occurs below 50 °C.
Methanol, methylamine and trimethylamine are used as substrates for methanogenesis.
The DNA G+C content is >50 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Methermicoccus shengliensis.
